page.title: 05FARMING IN KINGSWINFORD
page.content: In our area there are only two working farms, Park Farm which is normally known as{Home Farm}and{Ketley Farm which is just off Ketley Road in Kingswinford. {Home Farm}used to belong to the Earl of Dudley and was part of the{Himley {Hall Estate.}In 1948 it was bought by Mr. Knott whose family still own it. The farm is mainly arable although they keep cattle for grazing and also breed pigs. The farm covers 150 acres and is divided into fields, some of which keep their original names such as Black Barley, Drive and Church Fields. {Ketley Farm}is a rented farm and covers 36 acres. It was built in 1813 and is a dairy farm with 27 cows. There are also various fields in our area kept for grazing horses; horse riding being a popular pastime.
